bba121a0-328d-4ca7-b057-b1dd160cb4aa.description: The earners of this badge have completed 108.9 hours of coach-specific training in the Fast Track to ICF Credential Program. This program includes all the programs required to achieve the 60+ hours of Approved Coach Specific Training for ACC accreditation plus 7 hours of group mentor coaching and 3 hours of one-to-one mentor coaching. Thus, giving the earner a solid coaching foundation from which to pursue ACC credentialing.
bba121a0-328d-4ca7-b057-b1dd160cb4aa.name: Certified Graduate Coach

issuer.summary: issued by Coaching Out of the Box®

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF core coaching competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coach Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The Code of Ethics is designed to provide appropriate guidelines, accountability, and enforceable standards of conduct for all ICF Members and ICF Credential-holders, who commit to abiding by the ICF Code of Ethics.

badge_template_activities.title: The 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training Program™ draws from the most advanced knowledge base in the coaching field and is translated into a simple, intuitive, and highly transferable framework for busy executives and managers. Key Skills Covered: A five-step process for a coaching conversation, multi-dimensional listening, powerful questions that accelerate development and new insights, catalyzing bigger, bolder actions, and encouraging action, growth, and new awareness.

Coaching Fundamentals™ program, participants will learn the core coaching competencies taught to professionally certified coaches worldwide. Coaching demonstrations, case studies, and engaging exercises will ensure participants embed their learning concepts. Key skills covered: coaching overview, demonstrating ethical practice, embodying a coaching mindset, establishing and maintaining coaching agreements, cultivating trust and safety, facilitating client growth, and coaching skills practicum.

The Personal Groundwork for Coaching Program™ allows coaches to highlight and explore areas that are often at the source of where a coachee becomes stuck, self-defeating, or demotivated. This course places you in the role of the coachee. We take you through your own personal journey, using the process of self-reflection, development, and growth. Only once you have done the work yourself will you be ready to lead others through it.

Participants of the Advanced Coaching Skills Practicum program will refine their coaching skills by coaching others and hearing others coach in a virtual classroom overseen and critiqued by an ICF-certified professional coach. The environment fosters real-time learning for those doing the coaching and also for those who will be listening and providing later feedback on what they saw and heard in the coaching.

The COTBx One-to-One Mentor Coaching Program consists of three individual mentor coaching sessions with an ICF credentialed coach. Mentoring provides professional assistance in achieving and demonstrating the levels of coaching competency and capability demanded by the ACC and PCC credential level. Mentor Coaching for an ICF Credential consists of coaching and feedback in a collaborative, appreciative, and dialogued process.

ICF Credentialing Assessment Prep (CAP) Class is designed to prepare coaches who will be applying for an International Coach Federation (ICF) Credential. As part of receiving an ICF Credential, coaches will be required to successfully complete the ICF Credentialing exam(CE). Written by two of the pioneering coaches who wrote and developed the ICF Core Competencies, this program is designed to significantly boost critical thinking and understanding of the Competencies and Ethics.

b80c0f50-d683-44c7-b401-566d4f025f8d.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the competencies and acknowledged their commitment to addressing diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) in every coaching exchange — adapting and evolving the coaches’ mindset and presence to their client's needs. The ICF Core Competencies related to diversity and inclusion are intermingled in the program to train, support, and equip the participants to be successful in “Embracing Diversity in Coaching”.
b80c0f50-d683-44c7-b401-566d4f025f8d.name: Certified Diversity Coach

issuer.summary: issued by Coaching Out of the Box®

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coaching Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The ICF Code of Ethics describes the ICF core values, ethical principles, and ethical standards of behavior for all ICF Professionals.

alignments.name: be S.H.U.R
alignments.description: Explore coaching designed to increase presence through the “be S.H.U.R.” model; be Seen, be Heard, be Understood, and be Respected. be S.H.U.R is copyright© and Trademark pending P.A.L Coaching & Consulting, LCC

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a Fast Track to ICF Credential graduate, ACC, PCC or MCC ICF Certified Coach. Or a graduate of an ICF-approved Level 1 (ACSTH or ACTP) program of 60 hours or greater.
Demonstrate at least 12 hours of in-class learning and practice on the topic of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Reflective learning through group and 1:1 breakout discussion as well as in the form of weekly fieldwork which includes the practice of learned skills and techniques; journaling; and, preparation and presentation of approaches on scripted coaching scenarios.
Successfully pass two quizzes, which measure the candidate's knowledge of the course curriculum and application of learnings achieved in class.
Concise definitions, exercises, and discussions on diversity, equity, inclusion, belonging, bias, and microaggressions are explored and directly applied to coaching scenarios.

7e2956d0-baef-4723-9849-5371787ee60b.description: The earner has completed the asynchronous Train the Trainer program for the 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Practicum™ and has reviewed the critical content from the 5.5.5 program and has exited with a fully customized delivery plan and script ready for their first delivery.
7e2956d0-baef-4723-9849-5371787ee60b.name: Digitally Enabled Licensed Trainer

issuer.summary: issued by Coaching Out of the Box®

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must have completed Coaching Out of the Box® 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training Program™ in addition to a minimum of ONE of the following: A coach training program with a minimum of 60 contact hours as defined by the ICF Level 1 or ICF Level 2 or equivalent. Or have successfully completed both the Coaching Out of the Box® Advanced Coaching Skills Practicum, AND Coaching Fundamentals Program™. Or hold an ICF ACC, PCC, or MCC credential.
Successfully complete and submit a module-by-module delivery guide to the Chief Coaching Officer for review

Successfully pass the Train the Trainer Tutorial final exam, a comprehensive test on delivering the 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training that measures the candidate's knowledge and ability to successfully lead the flagship 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training Program.

Train the Trainer Tutorial (T4) takes the learner on a guided journey through the process of learning how to deliver the pragmatic and life-changing 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training program. The program takes 10 hours to fully complete and gives the participant a solid foundation from which to build on for their own delivery of this program.

7aa5ff46-5c6a-4eb2-a508-781b7a8536d8.description: The earner of this badge has been led through the 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training program™ by a Coaching Out of the Box© Digitally Enabled Licensed Trainers. Learners acquire tools that move them… from talking to others to new ways of listening. From building walls to building trust. From telling others what to do to asking powerful questions. From harsh truths to productive feedback. And from problem-solving for others to developing resourceful, self-reliant problem solvers.
7aa5ff46-5c6a-4eb2-a508-781b7a8536d8.name: 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training Program™

badge_template_activities.title: The learner is led through a series of lessons either live or live online following the 5-Step Coaching Exchange. Each participant is taught HOW they need to coach, WHAT they need to do, and WHO they have to be.

0cf777e1-6bd9-4a60-ad09-77ddd05af2f1.description: The Purposeful Conversations© Training Program draws from the most advanced knowledge base in the coaching field and is translated into a simple, intuitive, and highly transferable framework for executives, managers, and influencers.
0cf777e1-6bd9-4a60-ad09-77ddd05af2f1.name: Purposeful Conversations Licensed Trainer

alignments.name: ICF Accredited Course
alignments.description: This program is accredited by the ICF and provides the earner with 4 CCES.

badge_template_activities.title: Must hold an ICF ACC, PCC, or MCC credential
Must have successfully completed both the Coaching Out of the Box® Advanced Coaching Skills Practicum AND Coaching Fundamentals Program™.
Must have completed a coach training program with a minimum of 60 contact hours as defined by the ICF Level 1 or ICF Level 2 or equivalent.
Earner must have completed Coaching Out of the Box® 5.5.5 Coaching Skills Training Program™
Must also be a Digitally Enabled Licensed Trainer
Provide a delivery plan and script for this program.
The earner will be able to re-position the 5.5.5 Model and concepts for non-coach groups, managers, influencers, and senior professionals.
